wwpy.weight_windows

Weight window operations module. Handles storage and manipulation of weight window values through the WeightWindowValues class.

Classes

WeightWindowValues(header, mesh[, ww_values])

Weight window values container class.
class WeightWindowValues(header, mesh, ww_values=<factory>)[source]

Bases: object

Weight window values container class.

Internal container class for managing weight window values and operations.

Variables:

  • header (Header) – WWINP file header information

  • mesh (Mesh) – Mesh geometry and binning information

  • ww_values (Dict[int, np.ndarray]) – Dictionary mapping particle types to weight window arrays

Parameters:

  • header (Header)

  • mesh (Mesh)

  • ww_values (Dict[int, ndarray])

header: Header
mesh: Mesh
ww_values: Dict[int, ndarray]
multiply(factor=2.0)[source]

Multiply all weight window values by a factor.

Parameters:

factor (float) – Multiplication factor to apply

Return type:

None

soften(power=0.6)[source]

Modify weight window boundaries by raising values to a power.

Parameters:

power (float) – Exponent to apply to values (< 1 softens, > 1 hardens)

Return type:

None

apply_ratio_threshold(threshold=10.0, particle_types=0, verbose=False)[source]

Apply a ratio threshold to identify and modify extreme weight window differences.

Parameters:

  • threshold (float) – Maximum allowed ratio between neighboring cells

  • particle_types (Union[int, List[int]]) – Particle types to process (-1 for all)

  • verbose (bool) – Whether to print detailed modification info

Raises:

ValueError – If an invalid particle type is specified

Example:
>>> ww = WeightWindowValues(header, mesh)
>>> ww.apply_ratio_threshold(
...     threshold=10.0,
...     particle_types=[0, 1],
...     verbose=True
... )
Note:

When verbose=True, outputs include: - Time and energy bin information - Modified voxel positions and values - Summary statistics of changes

Return type:

None

query_ww(particle_type=None, time=None, energy=None, x=None, y=None, z=None)[source]

Query weight window values based on specified criteria.

Parameters:

  • particle_type (Optional[int]) – Specific particle type to query

  • time (Optional[Union[float, Tuple[float, float]]]) – Time value or (min, max) range

  • energy (Optional[Union[float, Tuple[float, float]]]) – Energy value or (min, max) range in MeV

  • x (Optional[Union[float, Tuple[float, float]]]) – X coordinate value or (min, max) range

  • y (Optional[Union[float, Tuple[float, float]]]) – Y coordinate value or (min, max) range

  • z (Optional[Union[float, Tuple[int, int]]]) – Z coordinate value or (min, max) range

Returns:

Object containing queried values and metadata

Return type:

QueryResult

Raises:

ValueError – If an invalid particle type is specified

Example:
>>> ww = WeightWindowValues(header, mesh)
>>> result = ww.query_ww(
...     particle_type=0,
...     energy=(1.0, 10.0),
...     x=(0, 10),
...     y=(0, 10),
...     z=(0, 10)
... )
